Title: ↩️ 🇺🇸🇮🇷 - A final addition: At this rate, Iran won't respond ...
Description: Rerum Novarum // Intel, Breaking News, and Alerts: 🇺🇸🇮🇷 - Some commentary from Admin. All of this time that Iran has been speaking loudly, putting up posters, and maybe even preparing for a proper retaliation, the United States and Israel have bulked up its defenses and continued to harass Axis of Resistance… 🇺🇸🇮🇷 - A final addition: At this rate, Iran won't respond at all. It's very tiresome and annoying to see Iranians puff up their chest ahead of a retaliation, and do literally nothing for weeks, sometimes months.

Title: 🇺🇸🇮🇷 - Some commentary from Admin. All of this time that Iran...
Description: 🇺🇸🇮🇷 - Some commentary from Admin.All of this time that Iran has been speaking loudly, putting up posters, and maybe even preparing for a proper retaliation, the United States and Israel have bulked up its defenses and continued to harass Axis of Resistance militias and affiliates across the Middle East basically unimpeded.Iran is either 1) biding time in order for a ceasefire to be put in place, 2) intentionally dragging its feet out of fear of a wider escalation in the region, or 3) is actually preparing a massive retaliation that would forcefully re-establish deterrence.In our opinion, regardless of what Iran's intentions are, we're closing in on nearly a month since Ismail Haniyeh was assassinated in Iran. In other words, Iran is very quickly losing its window of opportunity. The more time Iran waits to respond, the more time the US and Israel can bulk up defenses and thwart or significantly reduce the damage caused by Iran's retaliation.On a similar note, as Iran is losing its window of opportunity, it means a response will either come soon or much later. It could happen this week, and at this rate it could happen next month. Genuinely, nobody knows. There will be signs that indicate an imminent response, with as little as an hour's notice, but regardless, there's a window that is closing very rapidly.

Title: 🔁🖼 — 🇮🇱/🇺🇸 NEW: Newly leaked documents reveal that in 2018,...
Description: Forwarded From Middle East Spectator— 🇮🇱/🇺🇸 NEW: Newly leaked documents reveal that in 2018, the Israeli government sought legal advice on how to avoid requirements of the U.S. Foreign Agents Registration Act (FARA), which mandates disclosure of foreign-backed lobbying campaigns. They proposed creating a new U.S. nonprofit to continue their activities while evading FARA disclosure. They also retained a prominent U.S. law firm, including the former DNC counsel, to analyze FARA risks and provide strategies to circumvent registration.@Middle_East_Spectator
